oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of four generations of the Scott family of Henry County, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The oldest man, James S. Scott, wears a Southern Cross of Honor. Sgt. Scott, from Henry County, Tennessee, served as member of Co. F, 46th Tenn. Inf., CSA. Most of the 46th Tenn. were surrendered at the fall of Island No. 10 on April 8, 1862.; The enlisted men went to Camp Douglas, Illinois including James Scott. Apparently Scott expressed interest in taking the oath but no evidence indicates that he did. His pension applications indicates that he did not take the oath of allegiance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Scott, Frank B.;Scott, James S.;Scott, Richard Ernest;Scott, Richard Samuel
